tuv.seg: Rights of same-sex couples
Na cearta atá ag lánúineacha den ghnéas céanna
• Cohabitants • EU citizens and their family members
• Saoránaigh AE agus a mbaill teaghlaigh
In many European countries, legal recognition has been given to same-sex partnerships to varying degrees
In go leor tíortha Eorpacha, tugadh aitheantas dlíthiúil de mhéideanna éagsúla do pháirtnéireachtaí comhghnéis
In 2011 a statutory civil partnership registration scheme for same-sex couples was introduced in Ireland
In 2011, tugadh scéim chlárúcháin páirtnéireachta sibhialta isteach le haghaidh lánúineacha comhghnéis in Éirinn
Following a vote in favour of marriage equality in a constitutional referendum, the right for same-sex couples to marry was introduced in November 2015
I ndiaidh vóta i bhfabhar comhionannas pósta i reifreann bunreachtúil, tugadh an ceart isteach gur féidir le lánúineacha comhghnéis pósadh i Samhain 2015
Under the Civil Partnership and Certain Rights and Obligations of Cohabitants Act 2010 a statutory civil partnership registration scheme for same-sex couples was introduced in January 2011
Faoin Acht um Páirtnéireacht Shibhialta agus Cearta agus Oibleagáidí Áirithe Comháitritheoirí, 2010, tugadh isteach scéim chlárúcháin páirtnéireachta sibhialta reachtúil in Eanáir 2011
Under the scheme registered civil partners have broadly the same rights and obligations towards each other as the rights and obligations of married couples towards each
Faoin scéim, tá na cearta agus oibleagáidí céanna, den chuid is mó, ag páirtnéirí sibhialta cláraithe dá chéile agus atá ag lánúineacha pósta dá chéile
Since 16 November 2015, no new civil partnerships can be registered unless the couple have notified the registrar of their intention to enter a civil partnership before that date

Ón 16 Samhain 2015 ar aghaidh, ní féidir aon pháirtnéireachtaí nua sibhialta a chlárú murar thug an lánúin fógra don chláraitheoir go bhfuil sé beartaithe acu páirtnéireacht shibhialta a iontráil roimh an dáta sin
More information is available in our document: Civil partnership and same-sex couples
Tá níos mó faisnéise ar fáil inár gcáipéis: Páirtnéireacht shibhialta agus lánúineacha comhghnéis
Since 16 November 2015, it is possible for same-sex couples to become legally married and to have the same rights and obligations towards each other as opposite-sex married couples
Ón 16 Samhain 2015, is féidir le lánúineacha comhghnéis a bheith pósta go dlíthiúil agus na cearta céanna agus na hoibleagáidí a bheith acu dá chéile a bhíonn ag lánúineacha pósta den ghnéas eile
It is also possible for a couple in a civil partnership to marry
Chomh maith leis sin, is féidir le lánúin i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta pósadh
More information is available in our document on getting married
Tá níos mó faisnéise ar fáil inár gcáipéis ar phósadh
Under the 2010 Act cohabitants are defined as two same-sex or opposite-sex adults who are:
Faoi Acht 2010, is é an sainmhíniú a thugtar ar chomhchónaitheoirí ná beirt daoine fásta den ghnéas céanna nó den ghnéas eile:
• Not married to each other or in a registered civil partnership
• Nach bhfuil pósta lena chéile nó i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta chláraithe
• Not related within the prohibited degrees of relationship (broadly speaking, relationships which would make them ineligible to marry each other)
• Nach bhfuil gaolta laistigh laistigh de na céimeanna cosctha de chaidreamh (go ginearálta, caidrimh a dhícháileodh iad óna chéile a phósadh)
• Living together in an intimate and committed relationship
• Atá ina gcónaí lena chéile i gcaidreamh tiomanta agus dlúth
The Act amended a number of laws where rights are already available to opposite-sex cohabitants in order to make such rights available to same-sex cohabitants
Leasaigh an tAcht roinnt dlíthe a raibh cearta ar fáil cheana do chomhchónaitheoirí ar ghnéis dhifriúla iad chun na cearta céanna a bheith ar fáil do chomhchónaitheoirí comhghnéis

• The Residential Tenancies Act 2004 was amended to provide that a same-sex cohabitant of a deceased tenant has the same entitlement to inherit a tenancy as an opposite-sex cohabitant of a deceased tenant has

• Leasaíodh An tAcht um Thionóntachtaí Cónaithe 2004 chun soláthar go raibh an teidlíocht chéanna ag comhchónaitheoir comhghnéis de thionónta básaithe chun teacht in oidhreacht ar thionónacht agus atá ag comhchónaitheoir ar ghnéas difriúil é

• The Civil Liability Act 1961 now provides that a same-sex cohabitant of a deceased person has the same entitlement that an opposite-sex cohabitant has to sue for damages in the event of the cohabitant’s wrongful death

• Soláthraíonn an tAcht um Dhliteanas Sibhialta, 1961 go bhfuil an teidlíocht chéanna anois ag comhchónaitheoir comhghnéis de dhuine básaithe agus atá ag comhchónaitheoir ar ghnéas difriúil agair do dhamáistí i gcás bhás éagórach an chomhchónaitheora
• Qualified cohabitants as defined in the 2010 Act (see below) are now entitled to be informed about the registration of an enduring power of attorney under the Powers of Attorney Act 1996
• Tá teidlíocht anois ag comhchónaitheoirí cáilithe arna shainmhíniú san Acht (féach thíos) a bheith curtha ar an eolas faoi chlárú chumhacht aturnae sheasmhach faoin Acht um Chumhacht Aturnae 1996
The Act also introduced a redress scheme for cohabiting couples including same-sex cohabiting couples
Thug an tAcht isteach scéim chúitimh do lánúineacha comhchónaithe chomh maith, ina n-áirítear lánúineacha comhghnéis
To be a a qualified cohabitant for the scheme you must have been a cohabitant for at least 5 years or for 2 years if you have a child with your partner
Chun a bheith i do chomhchónaitheoir cáilithe don scéim, caithfidh go raibh tú i do chomhchónaitheoir do ar a laghad 5 bliana nó do 2 bhliain má tá leanbh agat le do pháirtnéir
If one of you is still married, then neither of you may be a qualified cohabitant until the married person has been living apart from his/her spouse for at least 4 of the previous 5 years

Má tá duine agaibh pósta fós, d’fhéadfaí nach bhfuil ceachtar agaibh ina gcomhchónaitheoir cáilithe go dtí go bhfuil an duine pósta ag cónaí óna chéile óna chéile do ar a laghad 4 bliana as na 5 bliana roimhe seo
Tax and social welfare
Cáin agus leasa shóisialaigh
Cohabiting couples (whether same sex or opposite sex) are not treated in the same way as married couples or civil partners for tax purposes
Ní chaitear le lánúineacha comhchónaithe (comhghnéis nó ar ghnéis dhifriúla) ar an gcaoi chéanna le lánúineacha pósta nó páirtneirí sibhialta do chuspóirí cánacha
Cohabiting opposite-sex couples were already treated in the same way as married couples in the social welfare system
Caitheadh le lánúineacha comhchónaithe ar ghnéis dhifriúla ar an gcaoi chéanna le lánúineacha phósta sa chóras leasa shóisialaigh
Since 1 January 2010 cohabiting same-sex couples are treated the same as cohabiting opposite-sex couples
Ó 1 Eanair 2011, caitear le lánúineacha comhchónaithe comhghnéis ar an gcaoi chéanna le lánúineacha comhchónaithe ar ghnéis dhifriúla
This follows changes introduced by the Social Welfare and Pensions Act 2010
Leanann sé seo athruithe ar thug an tAcht um Leasa Shóisialaigh agus Pinsin 2010 isteach
This means that one of the cohabitants will be treated as an adult dependant when the other cohabitant makes a claim for a social welfare payment
Ciallaíonn sé seo go gcaithfear le duine de na comhchónaitheoirí mar chleithiúnach aosach nuair a dhéanann an comhchónaitheoir eile éileamh ar íocaíocht leasa shóisialaigh
EU citizens and their family members
Saoránaigh AE agus a mbaill teaghlaigh
The European Communities (Free Movement of Persons) Regulations 2015 transpose EU Directive 2004/38/EC into Irish law
Trasdulann Rialacháin na gComhphobal Eorpach (Saorghluaiseacht Daoine) 2015 an Treoir AE 2004/38/EC isteach i ndlí na hÉireann
The Regulations provide for the facilitation of entry and residence for EU citizens and their family members
Soláthraíonn na Rialacháin d’éascú iontrála agus cónaithe do shaoránaigh AE agus a mbaill teaghlaigh

The Regulations also provide for a wider definition of "family member" , to include a partner with whom the EU citizen has a durable relationship, duly attested, and the dependent parents, children under 21 and other dependent children of that partner

Soláthraíonn na Rialacháin freisin do shainmhíniú níos leithne ar “bhall teaghlaigh” chun páirtnéir a bhfuil caidreamh buan ag an saoránach AE leis a áireamh, arna dhearbhú go cuí, agus tuismitheoirí cleithiúnacha, leanaí faoi 21 agus leanaí cleithiúnacha eile an pháirtnéara
This does not involve the recognition of such partnerships for other purposes
Ní áiríonn sé seo aitheantas dá leithéid de pháirtnéireachtaí do chuspóirí eile
Read more about residence rights for family members here
Léigh tuilleadh faoi chearta cónaithe do bhaill teaghlaigh anseo
